title: President's Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition, and the Reestablishment of the Presidential Fitness Test
summary: The document outlines Executive Order 14327, issued on July 31, 2025, which revokes and amends previous executive orders to reestablish the President's Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition and reintroduce the Presidential Fitness Test. The order aims to address declining health and fitness levels among Americans, particularly children, by promoting youth sports participation, daily physical activity, and good nutrition. The Council will consist of up to 30 members appointed by the President and will advise on strategies to improve national health, including the reestablishment of the Presidential Fitness Test and the development of school-based fitness programs. The order also outlines the Council's functions, administration, and the policy of the administration to create a national culture of strength, vitality, and excellence. The document emphasizes the importance of engaging all sectors—public and private, civilian and military—to achieve these health and fitness goals.
